intro: Lagenophora cuchumatanica, commonly known as the Cuchumatán bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
